page.title: 03HOUSING IN LECHLADE
page.content: On July 3rd. 1985 we went to interview Mr. Arthur Chase, Chairman of the Parish Council, on the subject of local housing. {HOUSES AND HOUSING PLANS.}Lechlade contains 540 houses and 49 more have received planning permission. In eighteen months 61 houses have been built. {TYPES.}Council houses total 133 and 407 are privately owned. There are 147 buildings in Cotswold Stone. {INFILLING.}Infilling areas are to be between Chancel Way and the Convent, off Sherborne Street and off Hambidge Lane. {FLATS}There are plans to build 35 flats on the playing field at a cost of approximately Â£28,000 each. These are intended for retired folk and first time buyers.
